name: Globtroter Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three night in August and really liked it. The staff was very helpful and honest and it was very much appreciated. The location was good because it was only 1-2 blocks from the main square in Old Town. We were able to walk everywhere which is what we wanted. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: We have stayed at this Guest House several times over the last five years. We always are happy to come back.
reviews.title: Nice stay, once more

reviews.text: So also at our last stay in June. My wife and me had a nice stay in Crakow. Staying at Globtroter make us feel well. The room are tidy and well cleaned, the Guest House is very good located in the old town. And the people who works there are smiling and welcoming, every time we are there.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: We will come back!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Arve Conradsen
reviews.title: excellent stay in krakau

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a warm little hotel just off the Historic Square. Not ten meters from the Old Town Square, but far enough to be very quiet without the hassles of the square itself.
reviews.title: The Staff and the Convenience Make For a Wonderful Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marek & Peter were terrific hosts, you can ask them anything. When they promise something via email, they make sure they have it for you. No confusion and no excuses, unlike many other cities (Paris). If you are interested in a pilgrimage to Auschwitz, allow them to make the plans for you. It is inconvenient and the trip back is a time for meditation not stress. They will arrange it and take the stress out of it. I do not however, recommend paying the Auschwitz/Birkenau museum a fee for what is essentially free and a merely ancedotal or cursory tour. GLBT travelers very welcome at this hotel with no fears. Note: at Auschwitz your history is invisible on their tour. Unless you do a self guided tour and seek out the photos of those who bore the pink stars.
reviews.title: What a lovely place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot thank this staff enough for their help and their very cosmopolitan attitudes. Poland is on the cusp of change-- go see it!
reviews.title: Fabulous location, helpful staff, uncomfortable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Krakow the first weekend in October 2009 and stayed in the Karpinski Suite. The Suite, the hotel and its staff exceeded our expectations - very friendly, helpful and personal throughout the stay. The Suit is bright, light, airy, clean and lovely furnished, situated on a small street in walking distance to the Market Square. The Suite is a real gem and Krakow is an amazing place worth visiting.
reviews.title: Perfect no frills accomodation in Krakow

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is suberb--convenient to everything in tourist Krakow. And the hotel has some good amenities (free Internet available for guest use, a guest fridge, in-room coffee/tea, etc.) and helpful staff.
reviews.title: To enjoy and to relax alone or with friends: Krakow and Globtroter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The St Thomas apartment lived up to all the reviews - spotless, a well equipped kitchen and plenty of room. The flat itself is located less than a hundred yards from the main square and an abundance of restaurants. I guarantee you won't be disappointed. My one caveat was that we like plenty of pillows but the pillow allocation was one pp.
reviews.title: Globtrotter made an old man very happy

reviews.text: Had we remembered I'm sure this would have been sorted as the staff were v. helpful.
reviews.title: Lives up to its slogan

reviews.text: Another thing, if you've got a little more money try out another Globtrotter apartment just round the corner. We stayed there one night; it was like an aristocrat's pied a terre.
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay!

reviews.text: Globtroter claims to be the frienliest guesthouse in Krakow and we found everyone working there to be friendly and helpful; location is great. Stary Kuchni a few doors down is great for meals. Rooms clean and comfortable and the place has character - would stay again.
reviews.title: great location and above average staff

reviews.text: Visiting Cracow for the first time my friend and I were thrilled to have found this place. Located in a charming courtyard, 2 minutes walking distance from the main square, in the heart of the old town, we couldn't have asked for a better location. The rooms were clean, with a nice en-suite bathroom. The staff was friendly and very helpfull, happy to recommend the best places in the area for breakfast, dinner or something to drink. On the same street as the guest house, just two doors down, there is an excellent day spa. All in all, we couldn't have been more pleased with our stay here, and will recommend Globetroter to everyone we know who are thinking about going to Cracow. Great value for money!
reviews.title: Charming hotel in old building set back from street in courtyard

reviews.text: A quiet guest house away from the streets of Krakow, with a friendly staff, large and clean rooms for the price of very little makes it the bargain of the year for us. Close to the main square (2 minutes walk), the restaurants (good food!!), - both indoors and outdoors, pubs, shops, churches, the busy street life - in short - the works.
reviews.title: Close to everything

reviews.text: I've been in Krakow second time. First it was about 20 years ago and it took only about a few hours. Last week it took only about one day and I spent in Krakow one night in small and lovely hotel Globtroter. When we came closely to the hotel building, it was close to midnight and I was really dead tired - and when I saw there a nightclub with lot of young people, I was afraid about noise... But as soon as we came to a reception and after than into the chamber, it was evident - the hotel is absolutely quiet!!! Really oasis :-) ...and something more about hotel - very friendly and likeable equipment (lot of wood is everywhere), absolutely clean rooms, clean bathroom and hot water :-) in every room there is tea and coffee pot with tea and coffee inventory, of course :-)
reviews.title: A Safe Harbour

reviews.text: I hope, next time I spent in Krakow much more time and today I know where we will stay!!! :-)
reviews.title: Staying in krakow be smarter than the rest stop at the globtrotter

reviews.text: I would like thank both the receptionist...
reviews.title: Best small hotel in krakow

reviews.text: Tana - Bratislava, Slovakia
reviews.title: Globtroter is For Smarter Globetrotters

description: Globtroter is located in a quiet courtyard in The Heart of The Old Town-80 yds from The Main Square. Our friendly, multi-lingual staff will do their utmost to make you feel that our home is your home. We provide you with comfortable rooms, all with en-suite bathroom, TV and telephone. Internet access and safe is also provided.
